results.title: Backyard theatre: Michel Tremblay and Andre Brassard
results.creator_credit: Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Playwright Michel Tremblay and director Andre Bassard have a talent for capturing the earthy wit and language of Montreal’s east-end working class neighbourhood, rendering them into live theatre described by some critics as “outrageously funny”. Both their vision and their style have had an important influence on other Quebec artists.

results.title: Back to life
results.creator_credit: Al Kane and Al Kane Productions
results.brief_description: A skilled factory worker suffers a nervous breakdown as a result of tensions and personality conflicts on the job and enters a mental hospital. He is diagnosed as a schizophrenic-paranoiac type. Calm, psychotherapy and occupational therapy restore him to good health. Through the support of friends, family, a social worker and a rehabilitation worker he adjusts to a normal life and is able to return to his job.

results.title: The Back of Beyond
results.creator_credit: John Heyer, Shell Film Unit, Janet Heyer and Roland Robinson
results.brief_description: Heyer’s romantic impression of life in the inland of Australia featuring the Birdsville Track and its postman, Tom Kruse. Highlights the isolation of the people on outback stations and small towns, and the importance in their lives of the postman and the pedal wireless. Notable in the history of documentary for its strong visuals and use of natural speech, and for being the first production of the Shell Film Unit in Australia. Commentary spoken by Kevin Brennan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Heyer, Shell Film Unit, Janet Heyer and Roland Robinson

results.title: Baby meets his parents
results.creator_credit: Lawrence K Frank and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality Development”.
Illustrates the concept that the baby is introduced to the world about him through parental provision for his biological needs. Three of the environmental factors influencing development are illustrated; the need for food, the need for unrestrained, normal elimination of body wastes and the need for protective care and love to foster feelings of security.

results.title: Baby and the bottle
results.creator_credit: David Bilcock and Cambridge FIlm T V Productions
results.brief_description: This film describes and demonstrates the bottle feeding of a baby. It points out important details which must be observed to ensure satisfactory feeding and demonstrates preparation and sterilization methods, including terminal sterilization whereby several bottles can be prepared and stored for future use.

results.title: Babies with bad hearts
results.brief_description:

results.title: Baama: land of the red gums
results.creator_credit: Boolari Films and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: An impression of the wild life along the River Murray, through the eyes of an old aboriginal fisherman (Aaron Briggs). Shows in particular the water birds of the swamps west of Albury; pelicans, herons, ibis, grebe, reed warblers, kites and cormorants. The connections of the various creatures and places along the river with tribal legend and tradition are recalled by the old fisherman. Photographed and recorded by David Corke and Peter Bruce. Narrated by John Morgan.

results.title: The Aztecs
results.brief_description: Describes the culture of the pre-Aztecs civilizations as evidenced in ruins, carvings, and murals of Tenochtitlan, Teotihuacan, Tula and Tenayuca. Emphasizes the important role of religion in the lives of Aztec people and re-enacts at Totihuacan, a religious ceremony as it might have been performed in 1500.

results.title: Ayers Rock
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions. Illustrates examples of weathering and erosion responsible for producing the features seen in Ayers Rock. Shows three types of residuals found in arid Central Australia, kinds of weathering responsible for the formation of Ayers Rock and emphasises geological time periods. Also notes in detail the caves, grooves and guttering, and the under-cut base caused by running water. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Axemanship
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Peter McLarin who has held world records for chopping in England, Australia and the United States, demonstrates the proper use and care of an axe. Principles of safety and efficiency are stressed.
